properties.Name: Arbitration
properties.Description:
Arbitration is a technique for the resolution of disputes outside the courts.  Parties to a dispute refer it to one or more persons (the "arbitrators", "arbiters"), by whose decision (the "award") they agree to be bound. 

This is a settlement technique in which the third party reviews the case and imposes a decision that is legally binding upon both sides.

Columns.Name: ArbitrationCaseId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an arbitration case.

Columns.Name: ArbitrationStatement
Columns.Description: The statement of the outcome of the arbitration.

Columns.Name: ArbitrationAwardAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of the award as a result of the arbitration.

Columns.Name: ArbitrationTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Arbitration Type.

Columns.Name: ClaimId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Claim.

Properties.Description:
Arbitration is a technique for the resolution of disputes outside the courts.  Parties to a dispute refer it to one or more persons (the "arbitrators", "arbiters"), by whose decision (the "award") they agree to be bound. 

This is a settlement technique in which the third party reviews the case and imposes a decision that is legally binding upon both sides.
